conclusion: Given data • Square side = 0.20 m • Only the left-hand half (width 0.10 m) is inside the perpendicular magnetic field. • dB/dt = 10 T s⁻¹ (directed into the page).
Magnetic flux linked with the portion of the loop that is inside the field Φ = B A ⇒ dΦ/dt = A (dB/dt) = 0.020 m² × 10 T s⁻¹ = 0.20 Wb s⁻¹.
Induced emf around the complete loop |ε| = |dΦ/dt| = 0.20 V. (Lenz’s law gives a counter-clockwise current because the field into the page is increasing.)
The wire is uniform; each of the four equal sides has the same resistance.

premise: The wire is uniform; each of the four equal sides has the same resistance.
conclusion: Therefore one side carries one-quarter of the total induced emf.
Potential difference between points a and b (the mid-points of the top and bottom sides on the right edge) |V_ab| = ε / 4 = 0.20 V / 4 = 0.050 V.

premise: Current on the right-hand vertical side flows upward (from b to a). In a resistive wire the potential drops along the direction of current, so point b is at the higher potential.
conclusion: Sign of the potential V_a – V_b = –0.050 V, i.e. the magnitude of the potential difference is 0.05 V with point b at the higher potential.
